posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked: Hello everyone, I want some of my subteam projects to focus on creating software tools that will help the FRC community, do you have any tools you would like to use?

posts.name: Brendan Conover
posts.cooked: Instead of making an entirely different set of tools, you could help contribute to wpilib. They have a lot that always needs doing and I am sure they would appreciate more help.

posts.name: Technologyman00
posts.cooked: What software tools are you thinking about?

posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked: I will look into it. my goal for projects is not robot software necessarily, but tools that teams need but don’t have right now

posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked: I only thought about one idea, that is to create a smart strategy planner that you can draw on the field, add robots to it, and backup the strategy for next matches or events. I don’t know how useful that would be tough

posts.name: Marcus Kauffman
posts.cooked: Make a wpilib plugin for neovim

posts.name: Amit sucher
posts.cooked: Same here actually, started working on it but it was a low priority and when I tried to implement it, most libraries did not support putting a picture as the canvas for some reason (or I just did not do enough research abt it) If you end up making something that does that, lmk I would love to see how you would implement it On the other side, I gotta say just drawing on a board/ ipad works really well for us, so yeah I am not sure 100% how effective this would be

posts.name: EricH
posts.cooked:
Print out one field layout. Laminate. Use white board markers to draw on top of the laminated surface. Take photo when complete, save to somewhere safe. Erase. Re-use.

Now you have the rest of the season to develop other tools or assist with WPILib.

posts.name: Amit sucher
posts.cooked: While I do agree with you on that, it would be cool seeing someone implement something like https://valoplant.gg/ for frc strategy

posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked: Yeah drawing on a board/tablet works for as well

posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked: Yeah that’s exactly why I don’t think it would be very effective

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
Screen size limits is another reason to print it out. You can zoom in on a screen, but you can’t look at the overall field in one large shot unless you carry a desktop monitor with you.

Eric probably has this size clipboard for pre-match strategy. You don’t even wanna see how big the scouting clipboards are. /J

giant clipboard 8 500×750 60.3 KB

giant clipboard 8 500×750 60.3 KB

giant clipboard 8 500×750 60.3 KB

Just so happens that I’m co-developing an app designed to assist with FRC competition teams on and off the field with the exact toolset you’re describing; whiteboard functionality is included, but we also have a team scouting list generator, easily accessible match table, and more (we’re also developing a live match scouting interface!). Here’s the link to the project- happy to answer any questions! GitHub - Skac121245/Robort at robortOfficial

posts.name: Amit sucher
posts.cooked:
I was looking at the strat canvas, gotta say it looks really cool, and I might steal some features (the api to get the team is a genius idea, also takes time to write the 6 teams and it always looks bad lmao).

Aside from that, here are some functionalities I would add: Different colors, it is easier for a team to know its paths and stuff, so showing to each team in the certain color is a pro.

and also, I noticed when switching tabs the teams are suddenly gone, this might be a little bit annoying so doing that it will show the teams on both match phases will be cool
Thank you for the feedback <3 We’ll definitely add the colors to our priorities- we’ve tried to address the switching tabs for some time, hopefully it will be resolved sooner than later!

posts.name: Amit sucher
posts.cooked: Hey I got a question, when adding the teams (when you pick a match) How do you assign where they’ll be in the screen? with xy coords? the problem I am facing right now that it works on my pc screen but in my laptop it looks weird
I’ll reach out to my development partner and reply back- wasn’t as involved with the strat board itself in creating the app

posts.name: Amit sucher
posts.cooked: Hey, I fixed that, but would still love to hear how you guys did it The way I did it, is I get the screen size, and then also a 1920x1080 (regular screen you could say lol), I then divide them (width/regularWidth) to get the ratio and multiply it relatively to where I actually want to put the teams numbers

posts.name: Ben Skraly
posts.cooked:
Wow, that miles smarter than what we did… BTW I’m the other co-dev of Robort. Anyway, this project just turned into something as we learned how to work in these types of environments (aka js, bootstrap, electron). I took a super naive approach (this will be explained in bad terms) and made a window outside of the canvas and field image to create a landing for the numbers and boxes. Then, just used XY coords to place them where I wanted. This also sort of future proofs it bc now all I have to do is change the coords and image and its done.

Also, your feature request like 2 replies above exists alread. You can switch the drawing color simply by clicking on each teams number and then color bars will illuminate on each side of the field to let the user know what color they are in. Finally, the teams not showing up in the next tab is a bug we are aware of. You can fix it pretty easily in the app though. Once you initially set your match from API or manual you switch tabs and either reselect the match or push the submit teams button again and they will populate once more. Then they should save for both sides. The paths will already save for each switch so nothing to worry about there.

Sorry this was long, but this stuff is cool… if there’s any other questions you have just shoot them our way! We’d be happy to help!
